reason: The market is showing strong signals of being in an Accumulation phase. Significant regulatory friction, highlighted by Coinbase pulling bill support and Senate infighting, creates policy uncertainty. The high failure rate of crypto tokens, even projecting into 2025, points to a necessary market cleanse and flight to quality. While institutional players like Figure are building out essential infrastructure for tokenization, indicating long-term bullish sentiment, the immediate market is weighed down by legacy issues from past collapses (FTX/Genesis) and ongoing regulatory ambiguities. This environment encourages cautious positioning by sophisticated investors while general market sentiment remains guarded, leading to potential consolidation within a defined range.
headlines: Coinbase pulls support from crypto market structure bill
More than half of all crypto tokens have failed — and most died in 2025
Figure joins stock tokenization race with new trading platform backed by BitGo, Jump
Senate banking chairman Scott: Trump-tied ethics clash doesn't belong in his crypto bill
FTX estate sets next creditor payout date as Genesis Digital Assets fights $1 billion clawback suit
